intro: Tonsella scabra, commonly known as the rough tonselle, is a small, perennial shrub native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or undergrowth. Tonsella scabra is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
